--- In gladiator@y..., Tom Ricket <TRicket@b...> wrote:
> Hiya, folks,
>  
> Just thought I'd jump in (I haven't been keeping track of the list 
lately, but saw this go by).
  
> About the Gladiator clone/improvement/etc. on SourceForge ... if the 
folks working on it (OpenGlad? :-) would like access to some or all of 
the source code, just let me know.  All of the original FSGames team 
is tied up 150% with Blizzard stuff, so we haven't had time to work on 
Gladiator in quite a while ... so anything we can get you to help with 
code, we'd be happy to supply.

I would like to have access to enough of the code to produce a/some 
new version(s) of the existing game.

To prove how serious I am, I have even made a list of 
changes (in order of feasibility/importance) for different versions of 
the game:

Gladiator Implementable Changes

The 1st new version should be about mostly taking care of known 
complaints.

3.8L
-establish a maximum walking/running speed
-create a "summon formation" attack and give it to orc captains 
(modify existing "taunt enemy' attack to accomplish this)
-increase the amount of damage done by soldier attacks
-fix the status bar indicator to handle values of millions for health 
and mana
-adjust spacing on the view info page to handle larger values for 
health and mana
-create a "exploding barrage" attack and give it to archers (modify 
existing "barrage attack" and "exploding attack" to create this)
-modify the program so that when a mage/archmage dies, its teleporter 
marker is deleted and removed from the screen
-modify the program so that when a character dies, any spells of 
protection on that are deleted and removed from the screen
-repixelate Giant Skeleton
-allow the program to restart creating new characters after it shuts 
down generators if the character count dips below a certain level
-modify energy wave attack
-bring all scenarios up to version 3.8 and have them saved in the game 
as version 3.8

This version should be about adding more features.

3.8M
-create a new character class of alchemist and give it the ability to 
create potions of speed, flight, invisibility, and invulnerability
-create a new character class of "High Priest" (a promotion of cleric) 
and give it the following attacks: heal/mystic mace, wide area 
heal/greater heal, shout curse, resurrect/reincarinate (modify 
existing "resurrect" and "summon image" attack to accomplish this)
-create a new character class of "Practical Mage" (another promotion 
of mage) and give it the following attacks: teleport/teleport marker, 
teleport friends/teleport foes, freeze time/slow down time, create 
blackhole
-create a new character class of "Assassin" (a promotion of thief)
-ensure that each character has 2-3 different attacks.

This version is mostly about setting up to implement the ultimate wish 
list

3.9a
-fix any bugs that cropped up as result of above changes	
-create hybrid character classes as a new order
-allow hybrid character classes to be placed in scenarios
-modify game to allow a scenario to be built with bombs, exploding 
bolts, etc ready to go off.
-give the scenario author the ability to scecify maximum number of 
characters for each team within the scenario file and when to reset 
the ability to create more character
-give the scenario author the ability to scecify maximum number of non 
living objects (trees, rocks, etc) for each team within the scenario 
file and when to reset the ability to create more non-living objects

This version is about implementing all the ultimate wish list

3.9b
-fix all known bugs
-allow the user to create hybrids from two different character classes
